documentation.text:
@notice Claims Rara owed to the caller, sending it to the designated address.
 No effect if the caller is not a targetted recipient.
 No need to call {mint} before making this call.
 Returns the amount transferred; for recipients, emits a {RaraEmitter} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to pushClaim"

arguments.value: FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to pushClaim

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to pushClaim"

documentation.text:
@notice Prompts a token emission, sending the balance to the address given.
 The address need not be set as the recipient. The amount sent is the
 appropriate emission at this moment.
 Only managers can make this call.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to flush"

arguments.value: FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to flush

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to flush"

documentation.text:
@notice Returns the total token amount emitted by the emitter
 up to this block, whether or not they have been claimed.
 (e.g. for an emitter that operates by mint-and-burn patterns,
 reports only the number left after burning.)

@dev Perform a token emission, sending the tokens to the address specified.
 The amount emitted is determined by the source emitter (all tokens
 emitted to this contract will be passed to the specified recipient) but
 an additional supplemental amount, up to the quantity emitted, will be
 transferred as well.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setRecipient"

arguments.value: FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setRecipient

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setRecipient"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setEmitter"

arguments.value: FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setEmitter

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "FlowSupplementEmitter: must have MANAGER role to setEmitter"

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

claim(address).notice: Claims Rara owed to the caller, sending it to the designated address. No effect if the caller is not a targetted recipient. No need to call {mint} before making this call. Returns the amount transferred; for recipients, emits a {RaraEmitter} event.

emitted().notice: Returns the total token amount emitted by the emitter up to this block, whether or not they have been claimed. (e.g. for an emitter that operates by mint-and-burn patterns, reports only the number left after burning.)

flush().notice: Flush all tokens to address given, including current token balance and tokens owed by the emitter. Only managers can make this call.

owed(address).notice: Returns the amount of Rara currently owed to the _recipient (the amount to transfer on a call to {claim}). For recipients, this value may change every block.

pushClaim(address).notice: Prompts a token emission, sending the balance to the address given. The address need not be set as the recipient. The amount sent is the appropriate emission at this moment. Only managers can make this call.
